a116-1.resolution: wq-494 created to monitor E session artifact gate compliance. Since then, s1361 ALSO failed artifact gate (no engagement-trace entry despite engaging 2 platforms per session summary). 2 of 4 post-A#116 E sessions have now failed the artifact gate (s1356, s1361). wq-497 was created from brainstorming to address root cause (budget reservation for Phase 3).
a116-1.metric_before: 1/5 E sessions failing artifact gate (s1356 only)
a116-1.metric_after: 2/5 E sessions failing artifact gate (s1356, s1361). s1283, s1278, s1268 pass.
a116-1.note: Fix ineffective — monitoring alone did not prevent recurrence. Escalating to critical_issues since 40% failure rate is structural.

a116-2.resolution: d061 marked as completed in directives.json. R#224 (s1358) acknowledged it and it no longer appears as an urgentDirective for any session type. B sessions s1360+ show no d061 assignment.

a116-2.metric_after: d061 status=completed, no longer assigned to any session type
a116-2.note: Fix effective. d061 completed and no longer pollutes compliance metrics.

critical_issues: E session artifact gate compliance at 40% failure rate (s1356, s1361). This is escalation level 2 — monitoring (wq-494) was ineffective, problem recurred. wq-497 (budget reservation) is pending but untested. If next E session also fails, escalate to R session for structural E session budget redesign.

recommended_actions.description: E session artifact gate failure rate is 40% (2/5 sessions). Previous monitoring-only approach (wq-494) was ineffective. wq-497 (budget reservation for Phase 3) exists but is still pending. This needs to be prioritized — the next B session should build wq-497.
recommended_actions.action: Prioritize wq-497 (E session artifact gate budget reservation) in the next B session. If the next 2 E sessions after wq-497 is deployed still fail, escalate to R session for structural E session redesign.

recommended_actions.description: summarize-session.py has a recurring NameError on line 174 (unbound variable 'status'). Affected s1277, s1363, and older sessions. Causes emergency summaries or truncated session-history notes, creating blind spots for session effectiveness analysis.
recommended_actions.action: B session should fix the NameError in scripts/summarize-session.py line 174. The variable 'status' is referenced before assignment in a regex match fallback path.
